fields.name: CAP_SIMPLE_RADIUS_DAMAGE
fields.description: When hit by an explosion, we'll simply block it instead of spilling it to entities behind us, the sv_robust_explosions cvar can also enable this globally when set to 0

fields.name: CAP_MOVE_SHOOT
fields.description: Tries to shoot weapon while moving

fields.name: CAP_TURN_HEAD
fields.description: Can turn head  always bone controller 0

fields.name: CAP_FRIENDLY_DMG_IMMUNE
fields.description: Don't take damage from npc's that are D_LI

fields.name: CAP_AIM_GUN
fields.description: Use arms to aim gun, not just body

description: Enumerations used by <page>NPC:CapabilitiesAdd</page>, <page>WEAPON:GetCapabilities</page> and <page>NPC:CapabilitiesGet</page>. Serverside only.
name: CAP

fields.name: CONTENTS_BLOCKLOS
fields.description: Things that block line of sight

fields.name: ALL_VISIBLE_CONTENTS
fields.description: Sum of all the visible contents enumerations

description: Enumerations used by <page>util.PointContents</page>, <page>PhysObj:SetContents</page> and as tracer masks.
name: CONTENTS

fields.name: DMG_CRUSH
fields.description: Caused by physics interaction and ignored by airboat drivers. This is used by the Rollermine and an unused animation attack called 'Fireattack' by the Antlion Guard [ACT_RANGE_ATTACK1](https://wiki.facepunch.com/gmod/Enums/ACT)

fields.name: DMG_BULLET
fields.description: Bullet damage from Ceiling Turrets, the Strider, Turrets and most guns.

fields.name: DMG_SLASH
fields.description: Used by the Stunstick, Manhacks, Antlions, Antlion Guards, Headcrabs, Fast Headcrabs, all Zombies types, Hunter, and potentially other NPCs attacks

fields.name: DMG_VEHICLE
fields.description: Hit by a vehicle (This will need to be set for passengers of some vehicle to receive damage)

fields.name: DMG_BLAST
fields.description: Explosion damage like grenades, helicopter bombs, combine mines, Will be ignored by most vehicle passengers.

fields.name: DMG_CLUB
fields.description: Blunt attacks such as from the Crowbar, Antlion Guard & Hunter

fields.name: DMG_SHOCK
fields.description: Electrical damage, shows smoke at the damage position and its used by Stalkers & Vortigaunts

fields.name: DMG_SONIC
fields.description: Sonic damage, used by the Gargantua and Houndeye NPCs

fields.name: DMG_POISON
fields.description: Poison damage used by Antlion Workers & Poison Headcrabs.

fields.name: DMG_RADIATION
fields.description: Radiation damage & it will be ignored by most vehicle passengers

fields.name: DMG_DROWNRECOVER
fields.description: Damage applied to the player to restore health after drowning

fields.name: DMG_ACID
fields.description: Toxic chemical or acid burn damage used by the Antlion Workers

fields.name: DMG_REMOVENORAGDOLL
fields.description: Don't create a ragdoll on death

fields.name: DMG_PHYSGUN
fields.description: Damage done by the gravity gun.

fields.name: DMG_DISSOLVE
fields.description: Forces the entity to dissolve on death. This is what the combine ball uses when it hits a target.

fields.name: DMG_BLAST_SURFACE
fields.description: This won't hurt the player underwater

fields.name: DMG_DIRECT
fields.description: Direct damage to the entity that does not go through any damage value modifications

fields.name: DMG_BUCKSHOT
fields.description: The pellets fired from a shotgun

fields.name: DMG_MISSILEDEFENSE
fields.description: Damage from npc_missiledefense, npc_combinegunship, or monster_mortar

description:
Enumerations used by <page>CTakeDamageInfo:GetDamageType</page>, <page>CTakeDamageInfo:SetDamageType</page> and <page>CTakeDamageInfo:IsDamageType</page>.

This enumeration is a bit field/bitflag, which means that you can combine multiple damage types using the <page>bit</page> library. You can use <page>bit.band</page> to test if a specific damage type is set.
name: DMG

fields.name: FL_ONGROUND
fields.description: Is the entity on ground or not

fields.name: FL_ANIMDUCKING
fields.description: Is the player in the process of ducking or standing up

fields.name: FL_WATERJUMP
fields.description: The player is jumping out of water

fields.name: FL_ONTRAIN
fields.description: This player is controlling a func_train

fields.name: FL_INRAIN
fields.description: Indicates the entity is standing in rain

fields.name: FL_FROZEN
fields.description:
Completely freezes the player
<bug>Bots will still be able to look around.</bug>

fields.name: FL_ATCONTROLS
fields.description: This player is controlling something UI related in the world, this prevents his movement, but doesn't freeze mouse movement, jumping, etc.

fields.name: FL_CLIENT
fields.description: Is this entity a player or not

fields.name: FL_INWATER
fields.description: Is the player in water or not

fields.name: FL_NPC
fields.description: NPCs have this flag (NPC: Ignore player push)

fields.name: FL_GODMODE
fields.description: Whether the player has god mode enabled

fields.name: FL_NOTARGET
fields.description: Makes the entity invisible to AI

fields.name: FL_AIMTARGET
fields.description: This entity can be aimed at

fields.name: FL_GRAPHED
fields.description: worldgraph has this ent listed as something that blocks a connection

fields.name: FL_GRENADE
fields.description: This entity is a grenade, unused

fields.name: FL_STEPMOVEMENT
fields.description: Changes the SV_Movestep() behavior to not do any processing

fields.name: FL_DONTTOUCH
fields.description: Doesn't generate touch functions, calls <page>ENTITY:EndTouch</page> when this flag gets set during a touch callback

fields.name: FL_BASEVELOCITY
fields.description: Base velocity has been applied this frame (used to convert base velocity into momentum)

fields.name: FL_WORLDBRUSH
fields.description: This entity is a brush and part of the world

fields.name: FL_OBJECT
fields.description: This entity can be seen by NPCs

fields.name: FL_KILLME
fields.description: This entity is about to get removed

fields.name: FL_TRANSRAGDOLL
fields.description: This entity is about to become a ragdoll

fields.name: FL_UNBLOCKABLE_BY_PLAYER
fields.description: This moving door can't be blocked by the player

description: Enumerations used by <page>Entity:AddFlags</page>, <page>Entity:RemoveFlags</page> and <page>Entity:IsFlagSet</page>.
name: FL

fields.name: FSOLID_CUSTOMRAYTEST
fields.description: Ignore solid type + always call into the entity for ray tests

fields.name: FSOLID_CUSTOMBOXTEST
fields.description: Ignore solid type + always call into the entity for swept box tests

fields.name: FSOLID_NOT_SOLID
fields.description: The object is currently not solid

fields.name: FSOLID_TRIGGER
fields.description: This is something may be collideable but fires touch functions even when it's not collideable (when the FSOLID_NOT_SOLID flag is set)

fields.name: FSOLID_NOT_STANDABLE
fields.description: The player can't stand on this

fields.name: FSOLID_FORCE_WORLD_ALIGNED
fields.description: Forces the collision representation to be world-aligned even if it's SOLID_BSP or SOLID_VPHYSICS

fields.name: FSOLID_USE_TRIGGER_BOUNDS
fields.description: Uses a special trigger bounds separate from the normal OBB

fields.name: FSOLID_ROOT_PARENT_ALIGNED
fields.description: Collisions are defined in root parent's local coordinate space

fields.name: FSOLID_TRIGGER_TOUCH_DEBRIS
fields.description: This trigger will touch debris objects

fields.name: FSOLID_MAX_BITS
fields.description: The amount of bits needed to store the all the flags in a variable/sent over network.

description: Enumerations used by <page>Entity:SetSolidFlags</page> and <page>Entity:GetSolidFlags</page>.
name: FSOLID

description:
Enumerations used by <page>Global.GetRenderTargetEx</page>. Clientside only.
<note>Some additional image formats are accepted by GetRenderTargetEx, but don't currently have enums in Lua and aren't listed here. See [VTF Enumerations.](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Valve_Texture_Format#VTF_enumerations)</note>
name: IMAGE_FORMAT

fields.name: JOYSTICK_FIRST_BUTTON
fields.description: Joystick buttons are in this range, but don't have individual enum names.

fields.name: JOYSTICK_FIRST_POV_BUTTON
fields.description: Joystick POV buttons are in this range, but don't have individual enum names.

fields.name: JOYSTICK_FIRST_AXIS_BUTTON
fields.description: Joystick axis buttons are in this range, but don't have individual enum names.

description:
Enumerations used by <page>input.IsButtonDown</page>.

It's also part of the <page>Enums/BUTTON_CODE</page>.
name: JOYSTICK

fields.name: KEY_LSHIFT
fields.description: The left Shift key, has been seen to be triggered by Right Shift in <page>PANEL:OnKeyCodePressed</page>

fields.name: KEY_LWIN
fields.description: The left Windows key or the Command key on Mac OSX

fields.name: KEY_RWIN
fields.description: The right Windows key or the Command key on Mac OSX

description:
Enumerations used by:
* <page>input.IsKeyDown</page>
* <page>input.WasKeyPressed</page>
* <page>input.WasKeyReleased</page>
* <page>input.WasKeyTyped</page>
* <page>input.IsKeyTrapping</page>
* <page>input.GetKeyName</page>
* <page>input.LookupBinding</page>
* <page>PANEL:OnKeyCodePressed</page>
* <page>PANEL:OnKeyCodeReleased</page>

It's also part of the <page>Enums/BUTTON_CODE</page>.
name: KEY

description: Enumerations used by <page>mesh.Begin</page>. Clientside only.
name: MATERIAL

description: Enumerations used by <page>render.CullMode</page>. Clientside only.
name: MATERIAL_CULLMODE

fields.name: MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SHARED
fields.description:
Do not create a depth-stencil buffer.
Use the default depth-stencil buffer if used as render target 0.

fields.name: MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SEPARATE
fields.description:
Create a depth-stencil buffer.
Use the created depth-stencil buffer if used as render target 0.

fields.name: MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_NONE
fields.description:
Do not create a depth-stencil buffer.
Disable depth and stencil buffer usage if used as render target 0.

fields.name: MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_ONLY
fields.description:
Create a depth-stencil buffer.
Use the created depth-stencil buffer if used as render target 0. Creates a color texture despite the name.
Seems to behave the same as MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH_SEPARATE.

description: Enumerations used by <page>Global.GetRenderTargetEx</page>. Clientside only.
name: MATERIAL_RT_DEPTH

description: Enumerations used by <page>notification.AddLegacy</page>. Clientside & Menu only.
name: NOTIFY

fields.name: PLAYER_ATTACK1
fields.description: Player attack according to current hold type, used in SWEPs

fields.name: PLAYER_RELOAD
fields.description: Player reload according to current hold type, used in SWEPs

description: Enumerations used by <page>Entity:SetAnimation</page>
name: PLAYER

description: Enumerations used by <page>ENTITY:PhysicsSimulate</page>.
name: SIM

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_KEEP
fields.description: Preserves the existing stencil buffer value.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_ZERO
fields.description: Sets the value in the stencil buffer to 0.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_REPLACE
fields.description: Sets the value in the stencil buffer to the reference value, set using <page>render.SetStencilReferenceValue</page>.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_INCRSAT
fields.description: Increments the value in the stencil buffer by 1, clamping the result.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_DECRSAT
fields.description: Decrements the value in the stencil buffer by 1, clamping the result.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_INVERT
fields.description: Inverts the value in the stencil buffer.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_INCR
fields.description: Increments the value in the stencil buffer by 1, wrapping around on overflow.

fields.name: STENCILOPERATION_DECR
fields.description: Decrements the value in the stencil buffer by 1, wrapping around on overflow.

description:
Enumerations for use with <page>render.SetStencilPassOperation</page>, <page>render.SetStencilFailOperation</page> and <page>render.SetStencilZFailOperation</page>. Clientside only.
<note>These enumerations are also mirrored as <page>Enums/STENCIL</page>.</note>

Also see this corresponding MSDN entry: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476219%28v=vs.85%29.aspx.
name: STENCILOPERATION

fields.name: SURF_LIGHT
fields.description: Value will hold the light strength

fields.name: SURF_SKY
fields.description: This surface is a skybox, equivalent to HitSky in <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

fields.name: SURF_NOPORTAL
fields.description: This surface cannot have portals placed on, used by Portal's gun

fields.name: SURF_NODRAW
fields.description: This surface is an invisible entity, equivalent to HitNoDraw in <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>

fields.name: SURF_SKIP
fields.description: This surface can be ignored by impact effects

fields.name: SURF_NOLIGHT
fields.description: This surface has no lights calculated

fields.name: SURF_BUMPLIGHT
fields.description: Calculate three lightmaps for the surface for bumpmapping

fields.name: SURF_NOSHADOWS
fields.description: No shadows are cast on this surface

fields.name: SURF_NODECALS
fields.description: No decals are applied to this surface

fields.name: SURF_NOCHOP
fields.description: Don't subdivide patches on this surface

fields.name: SURF_HITBOX
fields.description: This surface is part of an entity's hitbox

description: Surface flags, used by the <page>Structures/TraceResult</page>.
name: SURF

fields.name: TEAM_CONNECTING
fields.description: Connecting team ID, set when player connects to the server

fields.name: TEAM_UNASSIGNED
fields.description: Unassigned team ID, set right after player connected

description: Default defined teams in Garry's Mod. This does not include any custom teams created in custom gamemodes. Enumerations to use with <page>Player:Team</page>
name: TEAM

fields.name: TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT
fields.description: Align the text on the left

fields.name: TEXT_ALIGN_RIGHT
fields.description: Align the text on the right

fields.name: TEXT_ALIGN_TOP
fields.description: Align the text on the top

fields.name: TEXT_ALIGN_BOTTOM
fields.description: Align the text on the bottom

description: Enumerations used by <page>draw.SimpleText</page>, <page>draw.DrawText</page> and in <page>Structures/TextData</page>.
name: TEXT_ALIGN

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_HINT_DXT5
fields.description: Used in skyboxes. Makes sure edges are seamless.

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_NOMIP
fields.description: Render largest mipmap only. (Does not delete existing mipmaps, just disables them.)

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_NOLOD
fields.description: Not affected by texture resolution settings.

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_PROCEDURAL
fields.description: Texture is an procedural texture (code can modify it).

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_DEPTHRENDERTARGET
fields.description: Texture is a depth render target.

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_IMMEDIATE_CLEANUP
fields.description:
<deprecated notag="1"></deprecated>
Immediately destroy this texture when its reference count hits zero

(aka TEXTUREFLAGS_UNUSED_00100000)

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_NODEPTHBUFFER
fields.description: Do not buffer for Video Processing, generally render distance.

fields.name: TEXTUREFLAGS_BORDER
fields.description: Clamp to border colour on all texture coordinates

description:
Bit flags used by <page>Global.GetRenderTargetEx</page>. Information taken from [here](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Valve_Texture_Format#Image_flags)

<warning>These enumerations do not exist in game and are listed here only for reference</warning>
name: TEXTUREFLAGS

fields.name: TRANSMIT_NEVER
fields.description: Never transmit the entity, default for point entities

fields.name: TRANSMIT_PVS
fields.description: Transmit when entity is in players [PVS (Potential Visibility Set)](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PVS "PVS - Valve Developer Community")

description: Enumerations used in <page>ENTITY:UpdateTransmitState</page> hook.
name: TRANSMIT

description:
Enumerations used by <page>ENTITY:Use</page>.

Not to be confused with <page>Enums/_USE</page> used by <page>Entity:SetUseType</page>.
name: USE
